Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: I'm anxiously waiting for faketoshi to exploit the fatal flaw in bitcoin that only he knows about.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pretty sure it is the segwit funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technically they are implemented as "anyone can spend" outputs and the miners follow the new segwit rules and only spend if there is a proper signature...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if you had a lot of hashpower that honored the anyone can spend part and ignored the segwit signature requirement, then it seems you can spend all funds in segwit addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is why segwit adoption had to be slow, to prevent the temptation to do this. now with so many blocks mined it is hard to go back to day one. but i guess with so much segwit tx  in each block now, it could be that a new nosegwit fork of bitcoin can arise. of course even if it is technically possible people will just keep using the segwit version of bitcoin to preserve the economic state of the current chain
